website_summaries.verdict: An affordable modem option if you want to stop renting from your internet service provider.
pros: Approved for use with Comcast Xfinity, Spectrum, Time Warner, Cox, and more
Capable of download speeds of up to 343 Mbps and upload speeds of up to 131 Mbps
cons: Not compatible with AT&T, Verizon, or CenturyLink or with voice plans
Some buyers had issues activating this modem with their internet service provider

customer_reviews.title: ARRIS SURFboard SB6141 Modem - End of the road
customer_reviews.text: This particular modem is a great model and I had no problem with it for the 4 years I used it. HOWEVER, it's nearly time to retire it for most use. A lot of internet services and companies are no longer listing this modem version as compatible . The modem itself is several years old . In tech time , that's a lifetime. Many of the advancements from the software side (and a few from hardware) have blown past it and this model can no longer handle the speeds / advances. I recommend finding another one that specifically suits your current needs.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Started Dropping Connection after only 1 year
customer_reviews.text: Most cable companies try to get you lease their modems for a few buck (or more) a month. If you get a modem on your own, you can avoid paying a monthly fee forever for a modem that after a year, it would have made more sense to just buy one. Just one problem with this is that if the modem you buy stops working at about the year mark. It's unfortunate, but this modem started dropping its connection to the internet. Perhaps it's over heating. It got to the point where we had to unplug the modem and reset 3 or four times a day. They've got a two year warranty, so we'll have to check that out.
customer_reviews.author: Artoo

customer_reviews.title: Works great after a simple call to xfinity tech support
customer_reviews.text: Works great and my WiFi is the same speed as the one xfinity gave me (took internet speed test). Make sure you call xfinity to register your modem into their system and have your product serial # and all that ready for them. I didn’t know you had to call so I was resetting my router and all this extra work in the WiFi configs wondering why it wasn’t working so if you have xfinity and it’s not working CALL!
customer_reviews.author: kaos khan

customer_reviews.title: Pays for itself
customer_reviews.text: Pays for itself by saving you money on rental fees from your ISP. Mine lasted several years. My only gripe was that there is no indication of failure on the modem itself. Your internet just goes out. It took several hours and phone calls to figure out my modem had failed. It already paid for itself, so I wasn't upset. In fact, I bought a newer version (in black).
customer_reviews.author: Kenja Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work with Comcast
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t work well with Xfinity (Comcast). I spent about five months trying to figure out why my home internet connection keeps dropping sporadically. Imagine holidays with kids, bad weather outside, and neither TV or streaming or anything depending on internet not working? Turns out the reason was this modem, having read these other 1-star reviews I was convinced trying buying a more expensive modem (Motorola MB8600) and that’s it - all troubles were gone. Don’t buy this modem if you have XFinity/Comcast.
customer_reviews.author: Jarkko Kuisma

customer_reviews.title: Recommend going with a newer model - known issues
customer_reviews.text: This modem worked great for about 3 to 3 and a half years. I'm not sure what to expect in life, but for the cost I imagined it would work well for at least 5. At about the 3 year mark this modem would start to reset itself randomly every couple hours which eventually became every 20 minutes. I bought a newer model and this hasn't been an issue so far. I'd proceed with caution on this one from my experience but I know it's hard to nail down the exact issue with internet issues.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Landes

customer_reviews.title: Works great for Cablevision/Optimum
customer_reviews.text: I bought this modem back in September 2015 to hook up to Cablevision/Optimum in Central New Jersey. 10 months later, it still works great with no issues to report. I just had to call their customer service line to provide them the modem information, they gave me the usual warning that they aren't responsible for damage etc which I said OK, and boom, I'm no longer paying a modem fee on my cable bill. I even still use Optimum's "Smart Router" and no issues working with that too. Good purchase, I'd recommend it to fellow Cablevision customers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love This Modem!
customer_reviews.text: I waited a while to review this product. It's been well over a year and -- knock on wood! -- it is still going strong. Also, I had one issue (not because of the modem; I had changed my IP settings) in which I had to call tech support. They were brilliant and walked me through solving the problem in minutes. Very professional. I would definitely recommend this product to anyone that's looking for a reasonably priced, reliable modem.
customer_reviews.author: Marige

customer_reviews.title: Newer models now, but this still works fantastic and makes Comcast happy
customer_reviews.text: Comcast nagged and nagged me to upgrade and so I purchased this. No regrets. I should have done it sooner. Definitely sped things up some. I can't believe I never reviewed this, but it was in my list of reviews pending. One thing I'll say is the lights are bright, bright, bright. You can just slice the cardboard from a toilet paper roll or paper towel roll lengthwise, spread it and place around the front and it blocks a LOT of that light. I keep mine upright for heat dissipation although it is only warm and not hot.
customer_reviews.author: MikeK

customer_reviews.title: Well worth  your money
customer_reviews.text: A few years old now and still running strong. I bought this for use with Comcast so I didn't have to pay their rental fees. Their tech support originally said it isn't compatible but that's a lie. I insisted and escalated so someone who knew tech support could properly add it to my account. You must have them add it, you can't just plug it in and expect it to work.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Yawnos

customer_reviews.title: Good run for 4 years
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this modem in September of 2014 and overall the modem met most of my basic needs. Installation is as easy as plugging it in and calling a service provider to activate the modem with them. Overtime my service provider has increased their internet speed in the area and the modem is able to automatically adjust for it. However, overtime the modem has started to fail more frequently and drops connection. The modem performed very well for 4.5 years, but for the money I believe it should have lasted longer.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin J Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Its 2020 don't buy
customer_reviews.text: This product is from the past and as a person living in 2020, I don't think this is worth buying. There are newer models for around the same cost or even less with better specs. Just don't buy it. In addition, this product drops connection to my ISP (Spectrum). At the end, I had to give up on this product and use the one my ISP provided instead. Plus the ISP one was free.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this instead of the questionable combo router rented by SuddenLink (Northern California). This modem connects directly to my Apple AirPort Time Capsule (4th Generation). I did indeed have to inform SuddenLink that I have a new modem, which I did over the phone. After a month of operation, I felt like it was a keeper, so I dropped off the rental, which lowered my monthly internet bill. I went from having to restart the rental every day to never having to do any restarts using this product. It also seems like my download speeds have increased as well.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Earl Martin

customer_reviews.title: modem was already registered to another customer and could not be activated
customer_reviews.text: We got our inlaws comcast internet for christmas and went to set up the modem and it would not complete the registration. after a call to tech support at comcast they determined that the mac address and serial number were already registered to another customer in another state, and there was no way to activate it on our account. was forced to make a quick run to BestBuy to buy a modem at a ridiculous price last minute and miss out on family time . total bummer. The modem itself i can not say anything bad about all the factory items were included and i have used aries surfboards for years .
customer_reviews.author: Orion

customer_reviews.title: Seems like this item was returned before for this exact reason ...
customer_reviews.text: Upon opening the shipping box I could clearly see the product box had been opened before, it was resealed with clear tape. Even the power cord was not wrapped up and in it's plastic bag. Anyway, I thought no problem really so long as it works. Well after 20 minutes of no success it would not work and refused to connect. Seems like this item was returned before for this exact reason and just placed back in the warehouse. Hopefully the replacement item will be new and working correctly. UPDATE: New item appears to be working just fine so far.
customer_reviews.author: Tigger

customer_reviews.title: Good When It’s Not Dropping Signal
customer_reviews.text: Good when it’s working- frequently drops signal. I kept blaming cable company but they came out and showed me numerous times how this modem doesn’t show that it’s online even when working. Have it just under 3 years and the issue has become unbearable since 2 years, of course when the warranty runs out. I won’t buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of two

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for 3 years.
customer_reviews.text: I had this for 3 years with little to no issues. The internet tech had to put an adapter on the coax cable because of the service strength but that has nothing to do with the modem. The only reason it stopped working was because it got dropped but 3 years isn’t bad. Maybe it is getting a little outdated now with internet speeds going up too but the price has dropped since I bought it and it is a good deal now.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: does not work with spectrum's 200mbs plan
customer_reviews.text: The modem didn't work with spectrum. As a result I had to switch to verizon. It is listed as supported modem but the agent wont be able to activate it. I was told only 200mbs service is available in my area and this modem is only certified for 100mbs and thus it cannot be used. :(
customer_reviews.author: Zust

customer_reviews.title: I wish I could say something good about it
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could say something good about it. I hope and trust that my experience is NOT the ordinary, usual experience, but it simply didn't really work. It technically did connect to the internet here and there, constantly recycled, reset itself, was slower than Christmas in the rare moments it actually worked. I thought my troubled had something to do with Comcast's wiring in a new house I purchased, but I plugged in another modem and POOF, everything magically worked (with the OTHER modem, not this one). Proving the modem was the problem ... I have to believe.
customer_reviews.author: Digital Gangsta

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with it
customer_reviews.text: My old Motorola Surfboard modem was sometimes dropping its connection with a DHCP error only resolved by rebooting either the modem or router. Comcast must have made some changes since that modem was no longer supported (It used to be!). I upgraded to this one. Simple installation. I had to call Comcast and they loaded their setup info. Once they finished, I could no longer access the modem's management screens but that's not a big deal as long as it keeps working. I've been using it for a couple of months, sometimes doing huge downloads while watching Netflix. Very satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: Rolling Blunder

customer_reviews.title: up and running in minutes.
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my Comcast modem with this one. I shut down the old modem, the router and the desktop switch, discounted the power, ethernet and coax from the old modem and then connected everything to this modem. I turned on the modem, called Comcast, gave the tech the MAC address, then turned on the router and switch when he said to... and everything came up and running in a minute or two. The Comcast rep was a little shocked that it went so fast. I told him I did the same thing last week with my home cable modem. Now I can save the monthly charge.
customer_reviews.author: Stroke4

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 3 years, 3 months - fine before that.
customer_reviews.text: It worked for 3 years and 3 months. Then the ethernet interface failed. The modem showed itself to be on-line, but the failed network interface prohibited communications with the equipment behind it. Sorry this is not a 4-5 star review -- based on initial perceptions -- like seems to be the "norm" on Amazon. Rather, I have tried to give a potential purchaser a more fair, longer-term, perspective. Side note: I have had about 4-5 Motorola/Arris modems and each has failed in the two-4 year time frame -- AFTER the warranty expired.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonRick

customer_reviews.title: Designed acquiescence?
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for about 18 months. It is still the top available technology, my cable internet service hasn't changed, and my modem is cutting out all the time, requiring restart. Comcast tells me I need to upgrade. To what? They agree this is still good technology. Must be a failing modem. I guess this is one way to keep sellling modems, Motorola. Luckily calling Arris customer support yielded some helpful assistance in resetting the modem. I was given a ticket number and told to call back for a replacement if the reset didn't fix the problem. Here's hoping they pull through. If you are seeing the same problem, mention that there is a two year warrantee on your purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JSwen

customer_reviews.title: Just fine, just don't try to sleep near it
customer_reviews.text: Normally I'd give this five stars for being compact, reliable, and technologically up-to-date. But I'm subtracting one star for having obnoxiously bright and flashy LEDs. It lights up a dark room like a disco. The CATV comes in through my guest bedroom, so that's where the cable modem has to live. For guests' sake, I covered up the LEDs with black electrical tape, but even that didn't work. The white housing and numerous air vents still leaked plenty of light from the side, so now my only choice is to cover it up, which risks overheating.
customer_reviews.author: Eoban Binder

customer_reviews.title: ATTN: COMCAST USERS THIS PRODUCT NO LONGER WORKS FOR COMCAST/XFINITY SERVICE
customer_reviews.text: This modem worked fairly well for about 18 months, until Comcast decided to not support this modem. Before figuring that out I called Arris Customer Service and I must note that Arris has great customer service. However they do expect you to pay to return the modem to them, once received they do issue a new modem within 5 day. While 5 days doesn't seem too bad, being without access to a broadband connection for the better part of 2 work weeks is unacceptable in 2017. Asurion insurance is only willing to accept a claim if the product is out of the MFG warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Flores Family

customer_reviews.title: Best Product for a majority of Cable Provider's Plans!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, bought mine refurbished for a song and have been blazing down the information super highway ever since. When this was released most provided were in the 10's of MBPs but with Fiber rolling out slowly nationwide you may want to note that this model has a maximum theoretical download speed of 343 Mbps and an upload speed of 131 Mbps. That upload speed may bite a few lucky metropolitan users in the behind so check your plan maximum before focusing on the DL speed only.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Kanban so well

customer_reviews.title: It Works Fine With High Speed Comcast
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to this when I got higher speed Comcast Internet. This handles the 260+ Mbps service that we have just fine. At the time, it was on the recommended list by Comcast.
customer_reviews.author: thehammer

customer_reviews.title: OMG! This Thing is AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: After doing EXTENSIVE research, I found this modem to be the best one. I even got theto accompany it. Hooking it up was easy. It took about 15 minutes, but it configured itself to work with my Comcast internet. All I had to do was open a web browser (it automatically went to the account configuration page) and click a few buttons. I have internet only package for $60 a month after taxes (make sure they're not billing you for the modem rental). I pay for 50 Mbps down, 10 Mbps up. This modem gives me 180 down 12 up. It's a speed demon. It only has 1 port in the back though, so you will need a router.
customer_reviews.author: Rik Haines

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price for the improved reliability and performance
customer_reviews.text: Swapped out the 'rented' Netgear Modem / Router we had with our Comast Business class. We were getting maybe 60% of the speed we were paying for, plus constantly lost internet connectivity for newer devices. This unit is on the approved list for use, takes about half an hour to get things moved over from the old to the new equipment. Stupid simple to set up as well. Since installing, speeds are usually 90% to 110% of what our package is. Uploads are usually 95% and solid. No issues with losing connectivity at all. We paired it with an ASUS (RT-AC68U) Wireless-AC1900 Dual-Band Router and things have been rock solid and fast.
customer_reviews.author: The one you call Tim

customer_reviews.title: Best Cable Modem
customer_reviews.text: This arrived very fast and was super easy to connect. Hadn't realized my old Modem was on the way out until Cox checked it out for me. The Cox technician was the one who actually suggested the Arris modem for me and said Cox has found it very reliable, reasonably priced and relatively trouble free. I couldn't agree with him more and am so glad I found this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Leela

customer_reviews.title: plus this white modem is much better looking than the black box I was renting
customer_reviews.text: All I did was connect it to the coax and it works perfectly with my internet service with Atlantic Broadband. Decided to get this modem because I was tired of paying a rental fee for a modem. For this price, I'll have a return on my investment in 4 months, plus this white modem is much better looking than the black box I was renting. Hopefully,​ it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: bvcuba@gmail.com

customer_reviews.title: Died 45 days after install.
customer_reviews.text: Looked like it was "New sealed in box". Worked great for first month, then stopped. Chat w AMZ prime issued a refund/return. Just ordered NETGEAR Cable Modem 8x4 DOCSIS 3.0 and will keep my fingers crossed.
customer_reviews.author: truthseeker

customer_reviews.title: Great Comcast modem replacement without $10 rental!
customer_reviews.text: The perfect replacement for your Comcast cable modem that you pay $10 a month to rent. The $60 I paid for it was made up quickly. Kicking myself that I didn't do it sooner being that I rented that Comcast modem for two years! 😤 ***Please note it does not have a phone jack so your Comcast phone will not work with this modem.
customer_reviews.author: Joey Mack

customer_reviews.title: Refurb working like a brand new product
customer_reviews.text: 1 year strong and still going, can’t beat a deal like this. DOCSIS 3.0 was our main requirement for purchasing this and our speed is consistently around 100 mbps. Think I’ve only had to reset the modem once which was no fault of it’s own, installer accidentally unplugged our line at main junction box and it needed a reset once it was reconnected.
customer_reviews.author: T. K. Kendall

customer_reviews.title: Used item unusable, bad experience.
customer_reviews.text: Used... was sold without disconnecting it from previous account and could not be released. A day late from Amazon, and an hour of phone support and had to buy, and wait, for another. 6 days without internet is really hard... good thing I had enough mobile data to HotSpot. Shouldn't have had to, but at least I had the option. Reseller didn't test the operation...
customer_reviews.author: L A Shaffer

customer_reviews.title: Works great but blue LEDs are way too bright.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this modem for new service from TWC and it has worked flawlessly, so I have no substantive complaints. The unit appears to dissipate about 4 watts in service, so it gets warm over time. The manual did not specify whether horizontal mounting was allowed, so I left it vertical as shown to ensure adequate cooling. The only gripe I have is the intensity of the blue LED status indicators. They are so bright as to illuminate a room at night, and the constant flickering would be distracting for anyone attempting to sleep, as in a studio apartment. I fixed this by covering the face and part of the sides of the unit with cardboard, leaving openings for cooling.
customer_reviews.author: Metals Geek

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: We were having trouble with our Comcast cable modem, slow, poor signal retention, sometimes rebooting on its own several times per hour. Comcast said it was "working". After some research, we decided to stop paying them a monthly fee for that piece of garbage and get this ARRIS. It solved all of the problems we were having. At a later time a Comcast tech was here for an unrelated issue and said "you couldn't have done better" and he also said it was the same modem he used in his home. I thought that was a pretty good unsolicited endorsement. I am very pleased with this device.
customer_reviews.author: FSRGP

customer_reviews.title: It Works with Comcast.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Arris cable modem to use with my Comcast Xfinity service. I got tired to paying a $10/month rental fee, so I picked up one of these. It works. No complaints yet. I should've gotten my own modem a long time ago. I have the Xfinity "Double Play" package. In order to activate the modem I had to connect it and then call Comcast to register the device. They sent a ping to activate it and I was up and running in about 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: J. Medina

customer_reviews.title: Ok product.
customer_reviews.text: Works ok but not any different from any others I have owned. Original failed after just a couple months. Was replaced under warranty. (Now am down the shipping charges + extra charge if you need it right away. Otherwise wait with no internet. If you can wait then they will ship back but takes longer.) The replacement would not let itself be activated by the ISP. Had a hard time having it replaced because of course, now the blame game begins. Even after a specialized tech from the ISP came and made certain that all the signals and connections were ok and an old modem I had worked fine. Finally I got it replaced and it has been performing ok.
customer_reviews.author: Hector Munoz

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this cable modem
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this cable modem! After doing a little research to determine the best cable modem for my Comcast internet service, I purchased this product. While I only pay for 75 Mbps, I regularly get 90+ Mbps download speeds. I have used this modem for months now and I have only restarted it once. This is definitely the best modem I have ever used. I highly recommend this to anyone using Comcast internet service. I originally considered other modems with more recognizable brands, but this was rated better. To my knowledge, it performs MUCH better. As always, Amazon delivered this item with lightning speed and I was able to set it up with no issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: JustRobb

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install.. and use.. and it saves me money - heck yes!
customer_reviews.text: Being almost completely technologically illiterate I am so thankful that my computer geek bro-in-law recommended this modem to me! After combing through Comcast’s list of compatible modems, I noticed that this one did not have the best of ratings. In my experience, I could not be more content with the modem; it has been awesome! Setting the modem itself up was incredibly easy and it has worked perfectly from day one. My biggest gripe was how long I waited on hold with Comcast to inform them I would be returning my rental and saving $10+ each month. Thank you Arris Surfboard SB6141 for helping me feel like I am not entirely inept in the scary world of technology.
customer_reviews.author: jll

customer_reviews.title: Five Years and going strong
customer_reviews.text: I've had this modem for almost five years now, and it's been solid. It's saved me a lot of money on modem rental from Spectrum/Brighthouse/RoadRunner. It's also saved me from their super cheap (read: flaky) modem hardware. I've had to power cycle the modem maybe three times in five years, and those may have been due to external problems.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Cox

customer_reviews.title: Great cable modem
customer_reviews.text: Based on all the online reviews and Amazon reviews, the ARRIS Surfboard SB6141 DOCSIS 3 Cable Modem was a top rated item. It was an easy setup and no problems at all. I usually offer more detailed reviews, but there's not much to say about cable modems. I noticed a few negative comments about the bright LED control lights. I do agree that the LEDs are somewhat bright, but I didn't saw it as an issue at all. The simple solution is to put the cable modem behind your entertainment center or under a shelf. It works well and I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: This worked fine until just after the warranty ran out
customer_reviews.text: This worked fine until just after the warranty ran out. At that point it started to randomly reboot whenever it felt like it. I called Arris for some basic support questions to try to determine whether the hardware was bad or maybe it was an ISP issue. They wanted to charge me $40 an hour (since it was out of warranty) to answer my questions. I'm giving three stars because it did work well while it lasted but I had hoped for something that would last a while longer. On the plus side, the new TP-Link router I have is running like a champ and I learned my lesson and got the 4 year warranty this time...
customer_reviews.author: Charles B.

customer_reviews.title: Works, but not with my equipment
customer_reviews.text: My ISP is Time Warner Cable. I have been leasing a telephony model from them for 3+ years. I decided to switch to an Arris SB 6141. My computer configuration involves an Apple Airport Extreme Base Station (a wireless router) and an aging iMac. While the SB 6141 works with a direct Ethernet connection to my computer, when I introduce the Apple Airport Extreme, everything goes awry. Apparently, everything works individually, but collectively the whole thing collapses. Three useless hours at the Apple Genius Bar, An hour and a half with Time Warner tech Support asserting that "it should just work". -- prospective luddite
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan D. Osborn

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Garbage, just like what Time Warner uses. I have to reboot every day or two, and sometimes it won't connect for 10 or 15 minutes afterwards. I do a lot of streaming, but there is no reason why I would ever need to reboot, nor why it would work after I wait 30 second and reconnect power. I bought to save money compared to renting from the cable company, but that appears to bave been a mistake. All this started just after the 30 day return, but I don't feel like waiting 6 to 8 weeks to get one by returning this one....with no internet. Will hit the trash bin as soon as the new modem gets here.
customer_reviews.author: Pharmboy

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!  CAVEAT EMPTOR!  Absolutely the very worst customer service!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY! CAVEAT EMPTOR! Absolutely the very worst customer service! Modem started failing at 10 months. Tried to contact customer service via phone but got "Unavailable - Please Call Back" message. Contacted via website live messaging. CSR was unable to assist with warranty issue once determined was not working correctly. Insisted I call their warranty phone number BUT despite numerous tries over four days during normal business hours, always got "Unavailable - Please Call Back" message! Impossible to contact over the phone! Absolutely worthless! Ended up having to purchase another modem from another manufacturer. CAVEAT EMPTOR! DO NOT DO BUSINESS WITH ARRIS
customer_reviews.author: DR

customer_reviews.title: Using for over a year with Comcast
customer_reviews.text: Little late to write a review but after using this for over a year with no issues I thought it deserved a review. The initial setup took a little time but wasn't difficult. Obviously I am from a tech background so I could google and figure out a few things. Works with our Performance Comcast package well. I have had to reset the route maybe once in a month or so just if I feel the internet is not giving the speeds I usually see which is not a big deal. Upon restart it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: I wasted so much of my time to troubleshoot this piece ...
customer_reviews.text: It lasted 9 months then the internet connection kept dropping out 5 to 10 times per day. Needed to reset power to the modem to get it working. I wasted so much of my time to troubleshoot this piece of garbage and, by the way, their Customer Care & Technical Service are completely useless. They kept tell me that there is nothing wrong with their modem and the problem is elsewhere. Replaced with Zoom Cable Modem Model 5345. Contacted my ISP with the new modem's MAC Address. It is up and running in few minutes. It has been running rock solid for over a month now. Buyer beware with this pathetic product.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: Works great with TWCNYC Extreme or Ultimate but crazy bright lights
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: We recently upgraded to TWC's Ultimate Plan (100MB download/10MB upload) and the modem still works great. We often get speedtests over these amounts as well. Highly recommended. Original: We bought this to replace our rented router from Time Warner Cable in NYC. We've had it for a month with no issues. Our speedtests sometimes even come in higher than the 50MBps download/5 MB upload speeds that are included in our "extreme" plan. My only complaint is that the lights on the router are ridiculously bright and colorful. I'd like to keep them viewable so I can easily check them when TWC randomly disconnects us, but it's like xmas in our living room when they're uncovered.
customer_reviews.author: madly99

customer_reviews.title: DON'T rent the scam, get this!!!!1
customer_reviews.text: Laughing all the way to the bank. Got this for my Comcast connection. Signed a 2 year contract for ridiculously fast, and dirt cheap internet. Then claimed I moved, and did it again under my roommates name. They really tried to get me to shell out the $10 a month to rent something claiming it wasn't supported, but the model number is definitely approved and works. After using the same modem for 3 years (12*3*$10=$360) it's paid for itself a few times over.
customer_reviews.author: Teacher's Taste

customer_reviews.title: Solid affordable modem
customer_reviews.text: Good modem, used it with two different telecom companies and it's worked well each time. Small enough to fit on a shelf without taking up a lot of space. Had it for over two years without anything happening to it. Would recommend to anyone who needs a modem they don't have to think about or tinker with
customer_reviews.author: cici

customer_reviews.title: Cutting the cable
customer_reviews.text: I looked at our cable bill a few weeks ago...holy sh@$! Ten bucks a month for modem rental on top of Comcast's outrageous fees for cable, I've had enough. I bought this as the first step in cutting the cable and saving 200 bucks a month. Paired up with a Netgear 1200ac wireless modem, I have more than enough speed to stream to multiple TVs and wireless devices. Not to mention gaming on an Xbox one and PS4. Sling TV with Netflix, Amazon video, a Roku and Fire TV (different TV's) give my family more entertainment at a fraction of the cost. cut the cable and save some $$$!
customer_reviews.author: Woz

customer_reviews.title: Causes unstable connections
customer_reviews.text: this just goes to show you cant trust amazon review ratings This modem is running a Puma chip set that can throw at high random ping spikes because it malfunctions as it interprets data. This makes playing some online ping dependent games hard to impossible.
customer_reviews.author: Mintsharpii

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fast modem. It hasn't failed on me even once in the past 3 months. Updated: It's been 5 months since I last had this modem and it still works great. I haven't even once had to restart the modem. My internet is faster than my other friends who also has Spectrum. I use a free T-mobile wireless router that's not the best quality. The router uses to have a lot of problems with my previous internet. I haven't had any problem ever since using the router with this modem.
customer_reviews.author: Miro Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Easy install and is compatiable with Comcast
customer_reviews.text: We have Comcast and after a couple of tries, the phone operator from Comcast was able to verify the MAC and serial number of this unit and we were off to the races. Works just as good as the rental modem and it is 1/3 the size of the Comcast provided modem. I took one star off because this unit has a cheesy thin power cord and power adapter like your kids' rechargeable toys. The Comcast provided modem had a regular power cord, like on home appliances with no "power adapter" at the end. NOTE: If you have Comcast, you have one month to switch to your customer provided modem before they start charging rental fees for their modem.
customer_reviews.author: Prime customer

customer_reviews.title: I do love that its white
customer_reviews.text: Let me start off by saying is that ONLY reason i'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is because the LED are BRIGHT. Modem is in my bedroom. Lights are bright enough for it to be a nightlight. I do love that its white. Its works great with my ISP (grande communications). I'm provisioned for 100mb download and this modem delivers. Addedd pictures of the modem lights compare to the light on my router and my laptop dock. Then you can also see the modem in the dark.
customer_reviews.author: Frugal.Momma.of2

customer_reviews.title: Great modem!
customer_reviews.text: Best bang-for-your-buck modem. Easy setup and activation, I've never had an issue. There's a LOT of internet traffic at our facility, and this thing keeps up. I can not speak for longevity, I know other people have said theirs have started to wear out, but so far ours is chugging along nicely. we have a 150/10 connection. I am not sure how it would do under a gigabit connection.
customer_reviews.author: warriorseries

customer_reviews.title: it was not sending a good signal to the router most of the time
customer_reviews.text: I got this to upgrade my trusty Motorola SB5100 to the newer DOCSIS 3.0 standard and it worked well. Then after a few months I started losing connection almost every few hours. I suspected my new router (TPLink C9) at first since I was getting a yellow internet LED. Then noticed a few reboots of the modem in the logs. I think even when it wasn't rebooting, it was not sending a good signal to the router most of the time. I fixed the problem by swapping the cheap almost weightless power supply with the beefy well made power supply from my SB5100 with the same rating. I''ve been trouble free ever since. Hope this helps someone.
customer_reviews.author: OldGeekGamer

customer_reviews.title: The lights really are that bad
customer_reviews.text: If you have this modem in a visible location think twice about buying it. The lights will illuminate a room at night and there's one light that blinks constantly to indicate that it's connected. Even electrical tape on the outside won't cover the problem completely because light leaks out of the ventilation holes on the side. Some have suggested buying Lithograph tape to cover the LEDs. I am currently using duct tape. If you are in an office where it is always light, or the modem is in a closet, then this is an otherwise fine modem. My connection speeds are very good and so far it has been working reliably. 5-stars for the modem, 1 star for the lights.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Dont plan on Surfing with this
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this modem based on customer reviews. This modem has a intermittent connection problem. After installing I then purchased a new router then updated / replaced all my Ethernet cables trying to figure out why I was still having an intermittent connection. Finally a specialist from my cable company advised that this modem had a reputation for intermittent connectivity. Unfortunately by the time we figured it out my 30 day return period had passed. Since replacing this with a different modem , all connection problems have been resolved.
customer_reviews.author: P. Ledbetter

customer_reviews.title: Setup was very easy. Attach internet cable
customer_reviews.text: Setup was very easy. Attach internet cable, attach power cord and ethernet cable (I attached mine to my Apple Airport Extreme). Wait for the four upper lights to become steady and the "link" light to flash. Now, you will probably have to contact your internet provider(mine was Comcast) to activate the modem. This requires you to give them the MAC address found on the underside of the modem. Unfortunately, it took 3 calls to Comcast to finally get someone who knew how to activate the modem(ask for the modem activation department or specialist). Other providers may be more able to do this without hassle. Once set up, the speed increase was remarkable.Good luck.
customer_reviews.author: Dr.Z

customer_reviews.title: it just werks
customer_reviews.text: I use this with my Time Warner Cable (TWC) service. I have an (advertised) 100Mbps plan and get... close to that... but that's to be expected and is more than likely an issue with the ISP than the modem, but I'm not complaining. Had no issue installing it and getting it to work with TWC and my LinkSys router. May have to upgrade when gigabit comes around as this handles up to 300Mbps if I recall correctly. Still, it's nice to own your things instead of "leasing" them. Based on my ISP plan if I use this modem for slightly over a year it's more than paid for itself based on what they charge to use their own modem.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: BRIGHT LIGHTS, BIG SPEEDS!
customer_reviews.text: I upgrade from an older 2.0 surfboard but at the same time upgraded my ISP so I can't speak to the comparisons as I never tried the 2.0 against this one but I AM getting 95-100 mps down/22-25 mps up, which is pretty sweet. HOWEVER: the led lights are SO BRIGHT from the sides (vents) on the unit...I've never had to "hide" my modem in the past but now I feel like I have to build box! I may be an idiot but I see no way to shut off the led...I think other brands have an optional button for the led but not here. Works well just TOO BRIGHT!
customer_reviews.author: Duane

customer_reviews.title: Fast and easy out of the box
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Upgraded from an old Scientific Atlanta dinosaur. Definitely faster. We're on Cox cable, so did the online setup. The Cox directions weren't particularly clear, so I had to try it hardwired on a few different laptops (ChromeOS vs Win8) before it worked. Activation took 2 minutes tops and we were up and running. I haven't had to reset it once in the 2.5 months we've had it. I usually buy refurbished everything ( computers, hardware, you name it) but there were so many terrible reviews across all of my favorite online stores that I opted to buy the brand new model.
customer_reviews.author: Smelly SmingsleyTop Contributor: Nail Art

customer_reviews.title: A Reliable Network!
customer_reviews.text: I have used many different branded modems, by far none have been as reliable as this one here. I have had this modem for 8 months and have had not issues. I had a similar one but a previous model which I had used for 6 years. Great product and also comes in black. It has 1 Coaxial cable port and 1 Ethernet port. If you require different networks, I would suggest implementing a network switch in-between this modem and your routers. Overall, it is small and the LED indicator lights may be bright at night so you will need to cover it if it becomes a bit frustrating. Definitely recommend this product for home use!
customer_reviews.author: TechConsultant

customer_reviews.title: It works now
customer_reviews.text: Spent 1 &1/2 hours with the ISP just trying to activate the modem (a used unit). There were some serious one-off technical problems but at least some of the confusion was due to my unit having *white* power & internet LEDs. All official documentation say those two LEDs will be *green* to indicate 'on', but for the SB6141 I received this was not the case. Those two LEDs are unambiguously white. So unambiguously dim-white that in all the types of lighting I've tried there is not a single hint of green. I'm not colorblind. This is really silly. Arris should update their documentation.
customer_reviews.author: goat

customer_reviews.title: 3/5/16 lots of problems with comcast the last 2 weeks ...
customer_reviews.text: 3/5/16 lots of problems with comcast the last 2 weeks, they are incompetent and liars. They actually disconnected my house from the node to connect a brand new customer. Now they have 6 houses hooked up through splitters on a 4 way node. Today they are telling me this modem is not registering as a DOCSIS 3.0 and its outdated. they want me to go buy a brand new modem or rent one from them. just be aware, COMCAST says this is an outdated modem. I dont think the problem is with the modem, I think its with comcast.
customer_reviews.author: no entry

customer_reviews.title: Works fine...for first 45 days.
customer_reviews.text: Great...when it works. This item started to disconnect on its own approximately 45 days into ownership. Go figure right? It refused to reset properly for three days. Then all the sudden it starts to work again. Worked for another two weeks now it shuts off every ten minutes or so. I'm hoping based off the reviews that I got a dud and that this is an anomaly. Now lets see how Motorola/Arris customer support handles it since it is beyond the Amazon return window. Some items you can afford to have go down... this is NOT one of them!! Not happy at all.
customer_reviews.author: Robalva

customer_reviews.title: Ok, when it works; Customer No-Service!
customer_reviews.text: When it works, it works well enough. However, frequent automatic power cycling has been an issue since day 1. Was told by Moto/Arris customer support that either the power adapter or my power lines were bad. Put it on an UPS / Battery Backup and replaced the power adapter (at my own expense) and still the same problem. Customer Service did their remote test and said everything was good, not their problem, passed the blame to the cable company. "Cable Modem Reboot due to power reset" doesn't sound like a Cable Co. issue to me. Disappointed, will probably go with a different MFG when I've finally gotten fed up with this modem.
customer_reviews.author: Steve F

customer_reviews.title: Under their contract I even had to take it back to them 30 miles away if it goes bad. Three cheers for TW Cable
customer_reviews.text: I finally got tired of paying TW Cable $10/month rent on my modem. Under their contract I even had to take it back to them 30 miles away if it goes bad. Three cheers for TW Cable. This modem works great. I notice a significant increase in speed as well as quality of internet coming to my computers. Only 5 more months and it's paid for. Addendum - After getting rid of my cable modem fee, TW mysteriously raised my bill by $15. They said it was because is was scheduled. Funny how TW does things. But modem still works great. In fact much better than the one I was leasing from TW.
customer_reviews.author: roborant

customer_reviews.title: Works fine with Comcast basic service
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised with Comcast's plain-vanilla (non-Blast) 25Mbps data-only service, so yes, this modem is probably overkill for this tier of service, but I wanted late-model hardware for reliability and future-proofing against eventual tier upgrades. On signup I specified that I was providing my own modem, so this is not a replacement for their leased hardware, and I don't expect technical or billing issues, or those bogus charges that others claim to have experienced. I let the Comcast tech handle all installation and activation/validation with Comcast central. Home wiring was existing 75 ohm CATV cabling, with mediocre cabling run from the neighborhood distribution box, and new connectors installed by tech; YMMV!
customer_reviews.author: A. S. Templeton

customer_reviews.title: Check with your ISP for supported speeds on this model before buying it
customer_reviews.text: Despite its claimed "up to 343 Mbps download and 131 Mbps upload", and Time Warner Cable's claimed "100 down / 10 up" with this model I am only able to get 60 down and 12 up (which is better than the claimed 10 up, but far shy of the claimed download speed). I'll have to upgrade to the ARRIS SB6183 or ARRIS SB6190 (or another brand) to hit the 300 down / 20 up that I'm paying for. Sidenote: DOCSIS 3.1 modems are due out sometime this year. They wouldn't provide faster speeds than the above listed models on my particular ISP, but should be more "future-proof".
customer_reviews.author: Jason L. Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Setup with Comcast is an investment; worthwhile.
customer_reviews.text: Great throughput, affordable modem and definitely compatible with Comcast. Took me a couple hours on the phone with a rep to get them to set it up correctly, and I did receive the initial "You purchased this in a different state" argument, which is simply inaccurate. There are no state-specific protocol. If you purchase these used, Comcast may already have another customer associated with it - you just need to tell the rep to remove the old customer and add the modem to your account. This thing now saves me $15 every month and I have confidence that there are no bottleneck issues, and no WiFi interference with my router.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great modem to help cut the cord with cable companies!
customer_reviews.text: Great modem for helping my family cut the cord with cable companies! This modem was recommended by a coworker to help minimize my cable bill by paying to rent the companies equipment. This has been an excellent replacement and is very stable and works better and faster than the one the cable company provides. It was an easy setup and took about 10 minutes total. I just had to call the cable company and let them know I had my own modem, they sent a signal and boom, it works! This modem also has plenty of features and capabilities that I probably won't ever use, but I know it is solid and works great! Would recommend and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Zickus

customer_reviews.title: Works great so far
customer_reviews.text: It took about 30 minutes to get the cable connection working with the installer, but that is the fault of the cable company doing initial redirects to some silly registration web page (which of course the cable modem itself doesn't know how to fill in). Other than that, this has been flawless and simple. I guess the only weird thing is that there are no configuration settings that I could find, e.g. in the web admin pages for this thing. Everything appeared to be read-only. I guess that's ok if everything works well, but I do always like to go in myself and lock everything down in the configs.
customer_reviews.author: C. Purdy

customer_reviews.title: Works for TWC Spectrum customers
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this modem to replace a rental from Time Warner Cable TWC now Spectrum. Previously I tried Linksys Advanced DOCSIS 3.0 Cable Modem for Comcast, Connector, F-type female 75 ohm Cable (DPC3008) but that modem repeatedly disconnected and process of rebooting was so frustrating. I found a review stating Linksys had some internal coding that made some units often incompatible with TWC. I've had Arris running for a week and not one signal interruption. I am very pleased with speed and connection and only wish I had made this switch months ago.
customer_reviews.author: Newport News

customer_reviews.title: 4Gbit better let me expand to at least 700Mbit or something ...
customer_reviews.text: One of the few modems Comcast will let you get their 300mbit+ packages with, even if other modems are rated for far more. I can peg out 300/30 on my xfinity connection (provided they're up... cant fix that, though) anytime day or night with this modem. and 1.4Gbit better let me expand to at least 700Mbit or something in a few years, so there's some longevity built into this one, whereas the 340Mbit rated modems are NOT allowed to even try their 300Mbit packages, so those are on a shorter lifecycle than I believe people realize.
customer_reviews.author: omgerd yay buying stuff

customer_reviews.title: Unexpectedly great performance increase
customer_reviews.text: Just got this installed. I will try to come back and add to this review after I have it running a few months. I honestly only bought my own modem because I was tired of the $7/month charge for the one the cable company had given me. I expected some increase in speed, but this was great. The image shows my before (top) and after (bottom) and was taken during the first 15 minutes before they applied the throttle for my tier of service. Since that throttle has hit though I am consistently at the 60MBPS rate that I pay for finally. Very satisfied with the initial performance.
customer_reviews.author: Hardy J Ulmet

customer_reviews.title: Never worked properly; wish I had returned it the day I received it
customer_reviews.text: As others have stated, this modem is a piece of junk. I have the TWC MAXX plan in Austin, so we get speeds up to 300mbps. This modem constantly reboots with T3 and T4 timeouts. TWC techs have been to my house twice, showed me the network map for my neighbors, and I'm the only one losing connection. I spent four months trying to determine what the problem is, and blindly refused to accept that it was the modem. Lo and behold, it's the modem. The tech told me that they had to pull a ton of SB6141 modems out of the area because of defects. Simply put, buy the SB6183 or go to a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymousreviewer

customer_reviews.title: Stop Paying Comcast for a Bad Router/Modem
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased in combination with a TP-Link router to regain control of a Home network from Comcast. There isn't much to do with the modem itself, but knowing the performance capabilities of the modem makes this much better product than the typical ISPs default devices. This Modem should remain the best Bang for Your Buck Modem for a while still. Fiber is slowly spreading around the US, but it will be a while still before this modem actually needs to be replaced. The modem should pay for itself within months if you've been "renting" one.
customer_reviews.author: Atrarmh

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST IN MY CASE.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this so I could quit paying those crooks at sCamcast to rent thiers for the "bend over" price of 10 dollars a month and I have to say its the bee's knees..works perfect,set up was super easy and upload/download speeds are just what I pay for thru sCamcast. Already paid for itself with what I'm saving in rental fees. Great product, Highly recommend....BTW, its paired with the Netgear N900 Wireless router and together they are the perfect pair. I have had up to 13 different wireless items hooked at same time and have "ZERO" lag while streaming Netfix, hulu, kids on the Xbox etc.
customer_reviews.author: M.G.ROESEL

customer_reviews.title: Great product with tremendous speed and easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: I was shocked at how fast my home network is now. It replaced a UBee3. I had this in reserve for an emergency and on Aug 4 my house or tree near it was struck by lightning. I had an APC surge protector in my home office and it failed. Everything on it except a wireless printer was lost. Easy instructions and high speed so everything is great now. I'll probably buy another to keep in reserve. House is 1 story and about 2500 sq. ft. and the signal is powerful throughout.
customer_reviews.author: Dale S.

customer_reviews.title: Good modem to replace DOCSIS 2 hardware
customer_reviews.text: I only get a slight increase in upload speed over the DOCSIS 2.0 Motorola SB5101 I was forced to replace but no increase in download speed or decrease in latency. My upload speed with Comcast Economy Plus Internet now averages 1.05 and peaks @ 1.20 Mbps while the SB 5101 upload speed averaged .98 and peaked @ 1.07 Mbps. But my download speed continues to be between 3.58 and 3.59, peaking @ 3.73 Mbps and latency continues to be between 31 and 22 ms. Warning: If you can't get a DOCSIS 3.0 modem to work with your Comcast signal, Comcast won't re-authorize your DOCSIS 2.0 modem.
customer_reviews.author: Robby

customer_reviews.title: 1-yr or less lifespan
customer_reviews.text: Installed in Sep/Oct 2016, and has been acting up and dying for the last 10 mos. Crashes constantly, so that I lose internet access and since I work from home, school from home, and my husband works from home we use the internet all day almost every day. Very disappointing. So it lasted just about a year before having issues. Which of course we didn't even know what the modem at first, just thought it was our also disappointing ISP. Lose-lose.
customer_reviews.author: Lora Smith

customer_reviews.title: Buy it, and stop complaining!
customer_reviews.text: Very good Router! Really..it is that good! In fact, it might be the last router you might ever need. it's capacity is never utilized yet in todays market, but will grow as your service provider releases more bandwidth, and stops being stingy with it. If you have Time Warner, I feel sorry for you. The problem is not with the router, but your mischievous egocentric jealous monopoly bandwidth provider, throttling your bandwidth to get you to lease their equipment. Comcast does not have this problem, and are a better customer service provider in most markets. All the problems with earlier models this router is based on have been fixed, so you can use this router with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Get Rid Of Your ISP Equipment!
customer_reviews.text: I was considering going to the best SURFboard modem, but this one (a tier down) is more than adequate for my needs. Capable of speeds that exceed my ISP speed. I replaced my ISP provided modem that I was renting at $6/mo for 3 1/2 years until I actually got off my butt and decided to get rid of their $40 piece of junk that had so far cost me over $250 renting it, with no end in sight. I have yet to lose my connection (a frequent problem with my previous modem) and this modem, couple with the TP-LINK AC1900 Wireless Router I purchased at the same time has me one happy surfer!
customer_reviews.author: M. Dees

customer_reviews.title: Unusable due to continous power cycling.
customer_reviews.text: Continuously power cycled. Dropped the internet every 5 minutes. Motorola said it was the cable company's fault. The cable company said it was the modem's fault. (One cable rep said that this modem is sometimes shipped with the wrong power supply, the one I had was 12v 750mah.) I returned it... Update June 2015. On advice from other reviewers, I purchased a Zoom 5341J DOCSIS 3.0 Cable Modem that has performed flawlessly sine the initial boot. Not a single drop. If you are one of the unfortunate few for whom the Motorola cycles, skip the finger pointing and just try the Zoom. It worked for me.
customer_reviews.author: John Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Don't throw your money away renting!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this modem to use with Comcast Internet service and couldn't be happier. I was previously throwing money away by "leasing" a Comcast modem and finally got fed up with Comcast when they raised the price. I should have purchased one years ago! Setup was easy, just followed the instructions I found online (which you should print or write down first - obviously). It's been over a year and I couldn't be happier. I have had one of Comcast's fastest service plans and the modem has kept up without any issues. This purchase pays for itself after a few months!!
customer_reviews.author: Gill Wong

customer_reviews.title: Comcast Issue
customer_reviews.text: Comcast sent me an email & letter saying my older modem cannot deliver the speed I am paying for. They said I could get 150mbs download vs. the 100mbs I was getting if I upgraded my modem. My older 10 year old modem was a Motorola SB6120 so I bought this SB6141 modem which is capable of 343mbs download. This modem gave me the same 100mbs download as my old modem. I complained to Comcast saying their communications prompted me to buy a new modem and I essentially ended up with the same modem. They could only say that they were sorry. This Arris modem is a Motorola modem as evidenced by the similarity of the model numbers per Comcast.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: This is a very good modem, much like it's Motorola counterpart it offers ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good modem, much like it's Motorola counterpart it offers a solid connection and setup is hassle free. Plug it in and go! The only downfall is the management page is a little lackluster but you shouldn't be poking around in there anyways, unless you have issues. To get to it go to [...]1 from your browser and it has loads of information if you know what you're looking for. There is even a Reboot Modem button there which is nice especially if you have it tucked away somewhere out of reach and need to reboot it. The lights are a little bright, but that's nothing a little tape can't hide and is very very minor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonaholic

customer_reviews.title: Faulty power adapter causing repeated reboots, Amazon and Arris won't back their product
customer_reviews.text: Faulty power adapter causing modem to reboot over and over when under high load. Swapped out the factory 750mA 12V adapter for a 1A 12V adapter and it worked just fine. ARRIS won't warranty it because Amazon Warehouse is not a authorized reseller of ARRIS equipment. Amazon won't replace it because I'm beyond the return period. Buyer beware, don't buy this product from Amazon Warehouse.
customer_reviews.author: Kubel

customer_reviews.title: Once you hook up to a carrier, the carrier will have the right to flash new firmware on it
customer_reviews.text: $50ish for this or $132 over a year to lease one? Hmm, considering all you have to do is call the cable provider and tell them the MAC address of the modem and *poof* you have Internet access? Yeah. Definitely smarter to own one now that they're so cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Fruzzetti

customer_reviews.title: It's all good
customer_reviews.text: I had some trouble hooking this up and making it work, but after spending more than an hour on the phone with the cable/internet company testing wires and whatnot (we thought that possibly the wire included was a dud), I gave up, intending to do some internet searches the next morning to try to educate myself enough to figure out the problem. I went to bed and woke up to everything working perfectly. Still don't know if it was the signal or if the modem just needed time to sort itself out, but that was weeks ago and all is well. The signals test out fine and the modem is functioning as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: JPville

customer_reviews.title: Great for saving on Comcast modem rental fees.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Com cast was trying to tell me that I need a newer one but I insisted to connecting this one. Speed is more than enaugh for what I have from Comcast. They just try to sell the more expensive stuff that you don't need. This model was on their aprove list online but customer service representative was trying to tell me that it is on discontinued and not longer supported list. :))))
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better late than never
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe I actually installed this myself! Me being such tech nincompoop It was up and running in 10 mins. I had to reluctantly call Comcast in order to register the modem and also to stop charging me $10 something every month. Even after that, their bill is still high. I digress. I also noticed that my speed is much better than the xfinity gateway modem I had returned. This purchase was worth it. I should have done this 5 years ago but i guess better late than never. I paid $600 to Comcast all those years.
customer_reviews.author: Saffonda Cox

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: I chose this unit based off of it being recommended by my ISP. I'd rather buy the unit myself then have the ISP over charge me with "rental". I have seen mixed reviews, but mostly good. My experience has been great. Connected at first attempt and has held an optimum connection for the past month. I online game, stream music, and use VoIP ...all while my wife streams HD on our TV and uses her tablet to surf the web. I routinely check my connection speeds and have had no issues with speed or reliability from this unit. It does it's job... And looks pretty cool doing it being white with blue & white lights.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Jammin

customer_reviews.title: Problem solver!
customer_reviews.text: Our cable router provided by Mediacom died, they replaced it, we upgraded our speed and still often would give us disconnect messages and would many times not open web pages.......read reviews on Amazon, purchased this one, plugged it in and had Medicacom activate..........problem solved plus we will no longer be paying to rent one.....highly reccommended! Also read the reviews on our previous router.........you don't want to go there.......
customer_reviews.author: S. Mescher

customer_reviews.title: Working extremely well with Comcast business class service.
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install although the self-install didn't work with Comcast (go figure, something not working with Comcast!). Once they provisioned it online, everything went well. BTW, this is being used on a Comcast BUSINESS class service using a dynamic IP addressing versus the static IP's of their business modem. Stop paying Comcast $12.95 a month if you don't need five static IP addresses. It has been up since day one, not one dropout,no resets and it must do firmware updates in the dead of night because it never loses the connection.
customer_reviews.author: tom4416

customer_reviews.title: Save $ 120 a month. Get this Cable Modem!
customer_reviews.text: Swapped out an X1 Xfinity cable modem by Motorola. Depending on your location, you may have to work with Xfinity tech to register your ARRIS cable modem MAC address. I had to. Took 5 minutes. Everything is working fine. No issues like the other folks. I have this connected to a Gigibit Asus router and gettting 160-170 Mbps with Xfinity Blast. Save $ 120 a month and get this modem. I purchased the 2Yr warranty just for piece of mind. I was able to return the Xfinity cable modem via the UPS Store and they returned the Xfinity cable modem for free.
customer_reviews.author: Power T

product_meta.title: ARRIS SURFboard SB6141 8x4 DOCSIS 3.0 Cable Modem - Retail Packaging- White
product_meta.description:
Building upon the success of the SB6121, Motorola's SURFboard SB6141 enhances your personal media experience, at lightning-fast broadband speed. It harnesses the power of DOCSIS 3.0 technology to bond up to eight downstream channels and four upstream channels--providing you advanced multimedia services with data rates up to 343 Mbps download and 131 Mbps upload depending on your Cable Internet provider service. That makes streaming HD Video, gaming, shopping, downloading, working, high-quality voice and video conferencing, and peer-to-peer networking applications far more realistic, faster, and efficient than ever before.

AMAZON.COM
feature_bullets: Brown Box Models Not Valid for this Item when Sold As New, should Report to Amazon Immediately and Return to Seller

Approved on Comcast Xfinity, Spectrum (Charter, Time Warner, Brighthouse Networks), Cox, Mediacom, Suddenlink and most other US Cable Internet Providers. NOT compatible with Verizon, AT&T or Centurylink. REQUIRES Internet Service.
Wired modem only. Does not include WiFi router or VOIP Telephone adapter. Gigabit Etherent port to connect to PC or Router.
8 Download Channels and 4 Upload Channels capable of up to 343 Mbps download and 131 upload speeds. Recommended for Internet Plans up to 100 Mbps.
2 year warranty with US based customer service. Refer to the Quick Start Guide and Installation video. Supports IPv4 and IPv6 – the latest Internet standard
